references.paper_title: Expanding accurate person recognition to new altitudes and ranges: The BRIAR dataset
references.reason: This paper introduces the BRIAR dataset, a key dataset used for evaluating the performance of the proposed ProxyFusion method in challenging, long-range face recognition scenarios.

references.paper_title: RetinaFace: Single-shot multi-level face localisation in the wild
references.reason: This paper presents RetinaFace, a face detection method used in the ProxyFusion framework for accurate face localization, which is crucial for effective face feature extraction and aggregation.

references.paper_title: AdaFace: Quality adaptive margin for face recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces AdaFace, a face recognition model used as a backbone feature extractor for ProxyFusion, providing discriminative facial feature representations.

references.paper_title: Cluster and aggregate: Face recognition with large probe set
references.reason: This paper addresses the challenge of face recognition with large probe sets, a problem also tackled by ProxyFusion, offering a comparison and contrast in approach.

references.paper_title: CONAN: Conditional neural aggregation network for unconstrained face feature fusion
references.reason: This paper introduces CONAN, a related work that is compared against ProxyFusion, offering insights into different approaches to face feature aggregation and their relative strengths and weaknesses.
